values.description:
ign-rendering is having gz11 merged to default:

* https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/144/gz11-to-default/diff

This removes the custom gz11 branch jobs and disables the xenial default branch build. It also alphabetizes the list.
values.title: rendering gz11 -> default

summary.raw:
ign-rendering is having gz11 merged to default:

* https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/144/gz11-to-default/diff

This removes the custom gz11 branch jobs and disables the xenial default branch build. It also alphabetizes the list.
summary.html:
ign-rendering is having gz11 merged to default:

  • https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/144/gz11-to-default/diff

This removes the custom gz11 branch jobs and disables the xenial default branch build. It also alphabetizes the list.

values.description:
Fix issue #147. We were probably affected by [https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show\_bug.cgi?id=79736](https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=79736). The workaround is to use a higher version of compiler.

Tested:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_math-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=24)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition\_math-abichecker-any\_to\_any-ubuntu\_auto-amd64/24/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_math-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/24/))

Tested:

values.description:
We added `brew doctor` in pull request #752, but there was a `brew doctor` problem with lingering unpruned symlinks, but running `brew cleanup --prune-prefix` will fix it.

values.description:
homebrew bottle builds will sometimes fail when checking that a tarball exists at the specified URL, which can be problematic with the level of reliability in gazebosim.org

This points our releases directly at the s3 aws site for new releases. I'll update the existing homebrew formulae separately, which will look like the following:

* https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/pull/609
values.title: use direct s3 link instead of gazebosim.org/distributions since our web redirect is so flaky

values.description:
I noticed that `ros2_gazebo_pkgs-ci-pr_any_crystal-bionic-amd64` may return blue even if there are test failures. @scpeters suggested that this may be happening because the xunit files from the last package processed will overwrite the previous ones.

This change makes it so files with the same name don't overwrite old ones, and instead are renamed to have `~1~`, `~2~`, etc suffixes. I'm not sure though if whoever is processing those files afterwards will be happy with the extra suffixes.
values.title: Support multiple xunit files with same name

summary.raw:
I noticed that `ros2_gazebo_pkgs-ci-pr_any_crystal-bionic-amd64` may return blue even if there are test failures. @scpeters suggested that this may be happening because the xunit files from the last package processed will overwrite the previous ones.

This change makes it so files with the same name don't overwrite old ones, and instead are renamed to have `~1~`, `~2~`, etc suffixes. I'm not sure though if whoever is processing those files afterwards will be happy with the extra suffixes.
summary.html:
I noticed that ros2_gazebo_pkgs-ci-pr_any_crystal-bionic-amd64 may return blue even if there are test failures. @scpeters suggested that this may be happening because the xunit files from the last package processed will overwrite the previous ones.

This change makes it so files with the same name don't overwrite old ones, and instead are renamed to have ~1~, ~2~, etc suffixes. I'm not sure though if whoever is processing those files afterwards will be happy with the extra suffixes.

values.description:
Thanks to great work by @seanyen-msft, the gazebo tests now compile; so let's try running them. I expect many will fail to run due to not having all the dll's in the correct path, but we'll see if any of them do work.

I also grafted the commit from @\_jrivero_ to report tests results for Windows to jenkins.

Initial test:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-ci-gazebo9-windows7-amd64&build=95)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo9-windows7-amd64/95/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo9-windows7-amd64/95/
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_gazebo/481
values.title: gazebo-base-windows.bat: run tests using ctest

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_gazebo/481

values.description:
While making a patch release of ign-gazebo1, I saw an error message at the end of the console output from `release.py`:

~~~
...
- Linux: http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-gazebo-debbuilder/buildWithParameters?...
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/developer/release-tools/release.py", line 535, in <module>
    go(sys.argv)
  File "/home/developer/release-tools/release.py", line 502, in go
    for d in distros:
TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not iterable
~~~

I believe this is because [ign-gazebo-release](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo-release/src) doesn't have debian/sid or debian/stretch metadata, only Ubuntu. This patch should suppress the complaint if a repo doesn't have any debian distro metadata.
values.title: release.py: disable error message if no debian distro metadata is present

summary.raw:
While making a patch release of ign-gazebo1, I saw an error message at the end of the console output from `release.py`:

~~~
...
- Linux: http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-gazebo-debbuilder/buildWithParameters?...
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/developer/release-tools/release.py", line 535, in <module>
    go(sys.argv)
  File "/home/developer/release-tools/release.py", line 502, in go
    for d in distros:
TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not iterable
~~~

I believe this is because [ign-gazebo-release](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo-release/src) doesn't have debian/sid or debian/stretch metadata, only Ubuntu. This patch should suppress the complaint if a repo doesn't have any debian distro metadata.
summary.html:
While making a patch release of ign-gazebo1, I saw an error message at the end of the console output from release.py:

...
- Linux: http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign-gazebo-debbuilder/buildWithParameters?...
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/developer/release-tools/release.py", line 535, in <module>
    go(sys.argv)
  File "/home/developer/release-tools/release.py", line 502, in go
    for d in distros:
TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not iterable

I believe this is because ign-gazebo-release doesn't have debian/sid or debian/stretch metadata, only Ubuntu. This patch should suppress the complaint if a repo doesn't have any debian distro metadata.

values.description:
Gazebo ABI builds have been failing since we started using gcc6 for ABI builds on xenial in pull request #754. That pull request fixed ign-math5, but broke gazebo. This adds some a variable to allow jobs like gazebo to disable gcc6, but otherwise to use gcc6 for xenial ABI builds if the variable is not set.

* failing build with release-tools default: [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64&build=780)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/780/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/780/

* testing this branch [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64&build=781)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/781/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/781/
values.title: don't use gcc6 for gazebo abi jobs

summary.raw:
Gazebo ABI builds have been failing since we started using gcc6 for ABI builds on xenial in pull request #754. That pull request fixed ign-math5, but broke gazebo. This adds some a variable to allow jobs like gazebo to disable gcc6, but otherwise to use gcc6 for xenial ABI builds if the variable is not set.

* failing build with release-tools default: [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64&build=780)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/780/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/780/

* testing this branch [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64&build=781)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/781/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/781/
summary.html:
Gazebo ABI builds have been failing since we started using gcc6 for ABI builds on xenial in pull request #754. That pull request fixed ign-math5, but broke gazebo. This adds some a variable to allow jobs like gazebo to disable gcc6, but otherwise to use gcc6 for xenial ABI builds if the variable is not set.

  • failing build with release-tools default: https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/780/

  • testing this branch https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/781/

values.description:
My fix for gazebo ABI jobs in pull request #778 broke ign-math:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_math-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=32)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_math-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/32/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_math-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/32/

The `USE_GCC6` variables get filled in before the script is run, so I changed the logic to not depend on updating `USE_GCC6` inside the script. Testing:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_math-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=33)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_math-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/33/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_math-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/33/
values.title: fix gcc6 logic when USE_GCC6 is unset

The `USE_GCC6` variables get filled in before the script is run, so I changed the logic to not depend on updating `USE_GCC6` inside the script. Testing:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_math-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=33)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_math-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/33/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_math-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/33/

values.title: ign-sensors2: Ubuntu build rendering default branch from source

values.description:
The changes:

* One minor feature was added to DSL to be able to provide default values to debbuild jobs
* One patch to support SOURCE\_TARBALL\_URI in other forms a part from bz2

The procedure to release would be:

* Create a [release in github](https://github.com/osrf/ros1_ign_bridge/releases) using the procedure defined in that platform
* Use the [spawn\_changelog](#!/osrf/release-tools/src/default/release-repo-scripts/changelog_spawn.sh) tool on top of the [release repo](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/ros1_ign_bridge-release) with the new version tag
* Run the [debbuild job](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros1_ign_bridge-debbuilder/) providing only the following parameters:

    * SOURCE\_TARBALL\_URI: the URI from github releases page with the code tarball
    * VERSION: new version tag \(without revision\)
    

Testing run and testing packages:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ros1_ign_bridge-debbuilder&build=10)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros1\_ign\_bridge-debbuilder/10/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros1_ign_bridge-debbuilder/10/))
values.title: Support for ros1-ign-builder

summary.raw:
The changes:

* One minor feature was added to DSL to be able to provide default values to debbuild jobs
* One patch to support SOURCE\_TARBALL\_URI in other forms a part from bz2

The procedure to release would be:

* Create a [release in github](https://github.com/osrf/ros1_ign_bridge/releases) using the procedure defined in that platform
* Use the [spawn\_changelog](#!/osrf/release-tools/src/default/release-repo-scripts/changelog_spawn.sh) tool on top of the [release repo](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/ros1_ign_bridge-release) with the new version tag
* Run the [debbuild job](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros1_ign_bridge-debbuilder/) providing only the following parameters:

    * SOURCE\_TARBALL\_URI: the URI from github releases page with the code tarball
    * VERSION: new version tag \(without revision\)
    

Testing run and testing packages:

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ros1_ign_bridge-debbuilder&build=10)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros1\_ign\_bridge-debbuilder/10/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros1_ign_bridge-debbuilder/10/))
summary.html:
The changes:

  • One minor feature was added to DSL to be able to provide default values to debbuild jobs
  • One patch to support SOURCE_TARBALL_URI in other forms a part from bz2

The procedure to release would be:

  • Create a release in github using the procedure defined in that platform
  • Use the spawn_changelog tool on top of the release repo with the new version tag

  • Run the debbuild job providing only the following parameters:

    • SOURCE_TARBALL_URI: the URI from github releases page with the code tarball
    • VERSION: new version tag (without revision)

Testing run and testing packages:

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ros1_ign_bridge-debbuilder/10/)

I’ve used the name [DSLign-acropolis](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/DSLign-acropolis) to be able to compare it with the current \(and final name, I’ll change it\) [ ign-acropolis](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ign-acropolis)

The job list should be improved not have it hardcoded.

The job list should be improved not have it hardcoded.

values.description:
Try to work around issues with docker cache getting out of date.

before:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=955)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/955/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/955/


after:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=957)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/957/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/957/

The problem is that installing `libignition-physics-dev` doesn't upgrade all the other packages. Installing these other two debs seems to trigger the rest to upgrade, but I'm not sure another way to keep the versions synchronized.

values.description:
gazebo.dsl: schedule brew jobs to start between midnight-5pm to avoid 11pm router reset

The gazebo homebrew jobs take almost 4 hours. Currently the are scheduled to start randomly, with the gazebo10 job starting at 10pm each day and gazebo9 at 8pm. These jobs fail every time they start naturally because of network downtime at 11pm each day. I'm changing the schedule of these jobs so they should choose a random time between midnight and 5pm to start.
values.title: gazebo.dsl: schedule brew jobs to start between midnight-5pm to avoid 11pm router reset

summary.raw:
gazebo.dsl: schedule brew jobs to start between midnight-5pm to avoid 11pm router reset

The gazebo homebrew jobs take almost 4 hours. Currently the are scheduled to start randomly, with the gazebo10 job starting at 10pm each day and gazebo9 at 8pm. These jobs fail every time they start naturally because of network downtime at 11pm each day. I'm changing the schedule of these jobs so they should choose a random time between midnight and 5pm to start.
summary.html:
gazebo.dsl: schedule brew jobs to start between midnight-5pm to avoid 11pm router reset

The gazebo homebrew jobs take almost 4 hours. Currently the are scheduled to start randomly, with the gazebo10 job starting at 10pm each day and gazebo9 at 8pm. These jobs fail every time they start naturally because of network downtime at 11pm each day. I'm changing the schedule of these jobs so they should choose a random time between midnight and 5pm to start.

![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition-blueprint-nightly-scheduler&build=1)
[https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition-blueprint-nightly-scheduler/1/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition-blueprint-nightly-scheduler/1/))

values.description:
I recently merged sdf8 -> default, so now the default branch requires bionic instead of xenial

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=sdformat-ci-default-xenial-amd64&build=131)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-default-xenial-amd64/131/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/sdformat-ci-default-xenial-amd64/131/

https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_sdformat/702/
values.title: sdformat default branch jobs need to use bionic now instead of xenial

values.description: The nightly scheduler for blueprint is not being automatically called everyday. This PR fixes the build trigger to be `cron` instead of trying to check changes in a repository `scm`
values.title: Fix daily call to the nightly scheduler

summary.raw: The nightly scheduler for blueprint is not being automatically called everyday. This PR fixes the build trigger to be `cron` instead of trying to check changes in a repository `scm`
summary.html: The nightly scheduler for blueprint is not being automatically called everyday. This PR fixes the build trigger to be cron instead of trying to check changes in a repository scm
